name: Park Elegance Unique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was by far the worst hotel I have ever walked into! From the fake painted lobby, to the elevator that only held 3 people without their luggage. Our room, which was supposed to be a deluxe room on the top floor (7th floor) had worn carpet, torn and smelly bed spread, and a toilet that hadn't been flushed from the previous stay. The hotel safe was a box with a padlock which my 6 year old could probably hack into. The airconditioning was nothing more than someone blowing a couple of cool puffs into the room and the weather in Buenos Aires was approaching 90 degrees farenheit with 100% humidity. We promptly made our way back downstairs to check out of the hotel. After a 30 minute conversation with the on site manager detailing our displeasure, they were nice enough to refund our deposit and did offer us the services of their un-airconditioned business center (a small conference room on the 8th floor) where we were able to use their internet to book into another hotel. This hotel is clearly NOT a 3 or 4 star property as noted. They claim to be a "Boutique Hotel" and that is an overstatement in itself. The location is fair, but, you will still need to take taxi's to Buenos Aires popular attractions. The Kempinski group hotels in Europe are true Luxury finds! This location is one to be avoided at any cost! It should not be in the same category as their other properties!
reviews.title: DON'T Waste Your Time or Money on this HOTEL!

likes.liked: — Wear and Tear of the property
likes.disliked: — Do Not Stay at this location if it can be avoided

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An older, for the most part, cleanly kept property. But during our stay I had problems with the responsiveness of the staff. I paid an additional $60/night for a room with a 'sitting area' characterized in the website descriptions as including a sofa or loveseat. When we arrived we found our room had a single dining room style chair. The staff apologized and said they would try to get the appropriate seating moved to our room(we stayed for 9 days). An additonal dining room chair was moved to our room. I realize it was a busy week, and no other rooms were available. I suggested perhaps the premium we paid for the sitting area could be fully or partially refunded. I was flatly denied, their reasoning that the empty 6 by 6 foot area where the sofa should have been was the reason for the higher room price. No refund of any sort, courtesy meal in the restaurant, nothing. Our room air conditioner was not cooling the room enough to avoid sweating while sleeping at night. After two days and 2 visits from the maintenance man insisting we were improperly adjusting the thermostat, I removed the air conditioner filter clogged with dirt and rinsed it out in the sink. It functioned fine after that. Also, our room doorknob had the annoying characteristic of falling off. For this area of town and this money, you can do better with a bit of searching. The staff will be apologetic but when it comes to correcting the problem or making good on promised amenities, forget it.
reviews.title: Decent value, below average service

likes.disliked: — The attitude and helpfulness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kempinski Park Elegance was a very nice hotel for our 5 day stay in Buenos Aires this past January. The staff is friendly and bilingual, and the hotel is clean and for Argentina standards, roomy. The location is safe, and fairly close to many of the sights in the Recoleta nieghborhood. It was about 3-5 blocks to the subway station, or another option is taking a cab which is cheap in B.A.. The included breakfast was just average.
reviews.title: nice location, good value

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, good location, secure building
likes.disliked: — Elevator was out of service while we were there, but wasn't a big problem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say Kempinski charges a fair price for the value, and would give it a review of somewhere between 3-4 stars.
reviews.title: Perfect, romantic, exquisite and not too expensive.

likes.disliked: — Not enough room to walk/ sit in the breakfast restaurant

reviews.text: I did not expect this hotel to look as good as the pictures but was quite surprised. We made an early check in at 1 PM and were first accomodated into the "maid's bedroom", one of the twin tiny rooms on the ground floor between the buzzy reception desk and the noisy breafast restaurant. But when we went out for a day around the city (not a very central location but lovely posh area and close to the subway that takes you into downtown in some 20 minutes) we returned and requested a change. The new bedroom was superb, loads more room than in most hotels I have been to, and the decoration was fantastic. My boyfriend and me wish we could have stayed there more (only 1 night and we were out and about all the time!) and would definitely choose it again and recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: nice hotel in busy buenos aires

reviews.text: Parts of it are extremely well appointed but parts are fading a bit....paint chipping. Staff was very well trained and very polite...acted like English butlers in the way they pampered you. Great location!!! lots of little restaurants nearby for delicious cheap meals. A little small but everything was very clean and crisp. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Pleasant Place
Park with a good deal of elegance...
reviews.text: We have just arrived back from our South American travels and would highly recommend this hotel! Especially for those who dont like big clinical hotels in which you could be anywhere in the world, but still want the same service and a little luxury. Loved the decor, it was intimate and quirky, the lift is not for the claustrophobic!
Staff are all great, most fluent English speaking, and the breakfasts are good too.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Only one negative....they advertise a swimming pool which was a requirement, and when we arrived they did not have. You would have to go down to another hotel and pay for pool facilities. So dont expect it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: To summarise situated in Recoletta district, very safe, clean, near the cemetary and close enough to the metro which takes you 10 mins into city centre.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Kempinksi on Pueyrredon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is overrated - not at all like the pictures on their website. The room was large (we booked a superior room - the regular rooms looked small), but the mattress was old and mushy, the pillows were yellow under their covers, and the hotel just looked like it had its heyday in the 1930's. Breakfast was okay, no internet in rooms other than Wi-Fi. Very overpriced.
reviews.title: Way overpriced
never stay here
reviews.text: we booked the hotel based on the Kempinski name (great experiences elsewhere) and it was a terrible experiece. i felt uncomfortable to walk in barefeet on the floor - the place had an odor, was extremely worn, bad service, rude staff, noisy - even the continental breakfast tasted like it was right out of freezer. we looked around to move rooms - but nothing was better. we avoided the hotel which made our trip tiring.

I had a very pleasant stay at the hotel last week. The room was tastefully decorated and spatious. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The only problem I had was that the wardrobe stank of moth balls--so I could not put my suitcase or any clothes in there. The location is also nice--a 10-min walk to Plaza Francia and the cemetery where Evita's tomb is located.
reviews.title: Sincerely enjoyed my stay at this hotel
unpleasant stay
reviews.text: All in all, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very unpleasant; old, worn out, smelly. Rooms are in desperate need of renovation. This hotel should be stripped of several stars (not more than a 2 star hotel at most). Staff is unprofessional and rude.
reviews.title: staff is hell!
Decent Hotel - Excellent Staff
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights during the last week of November. The staff were outstanding. Extremely helpful in providing advice and good reliable tips in navigating Buenos Aires. The only downside were the rooms. I asked for a quiet room and was given a quiet room but deep within the bowels of the hotel. Our window essentially looked into another room and we hardly ever got any sunlight. The rooms themselves were functional but very cheap looking. They felt more like hostel rooms. All white, cheap paintings, cheap bedding and a cheap television set although we got a good channel selection. The attached bathroom was decent but tight. Another important point; there were no irons. Apprarently due to a safety hazard irons are not permitted. They have an ironing service avaible but it takes 24 hours to get your clothes back. This can become annoying...The airconditioner is a neccesity this time of year in BA but ours was a small wheezy machine that labored hard to keep the room moderately cool. It also took a while to cool the room and this became a problem especially if you were out all day and retuned in the evening ready for a good nights rest.

reviews.title: So So!
reviews.text: If don't want to spend too much on a hotel and are willing to put up with the below average rooms (which are thoroughly functional but lacking otherwise) then this is great hotel in a superb location with outstanding English speaking staff.

The only thing this hotel has going for it is it's good location. I chose this Hotel because of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I must say I was disappointed. Rooms where dirty and somewhat smelly at first, until I told them to please not use their airfreshener. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, great deal

reviews.text: What a great little hotel in Recoleta! After using Trip Advisor
reviews.title: Outstanding staff

description: Boutique hotel with an exclusive Safari decor.
